intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. validiglandulum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant has basal and stem leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in supporting pollinators.
